bayesquad.maths_helpers module¶

A home for complicated mathematical operations which are used multiple times in this package.

bayesquad.maths_helpers.hessian_of_f_squared_times_g(*, f: numpy.ndarray, f_jacobian: numpy.ndarray, f_hessian: numpy.ndarray, g: numpy.ndarray, g_jacobian: numpy.ndarray, g_hessian: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Given two functions f and g, along with their jacobian and hessian, returns the hessian of the function f^2 * g.

Parameters:
  • f – A 1D array whose \(i\)-th element is the value of the function \(f\) at point \(x_i\).
  • f_jacobian – A 2D array whose \((i,j)\)-th element is the \(j\)-th component of the jacobian of \(f\) at point \(x_i\).
  • f_hessian – A 3D array whose \((i,j,k)\)-th element is the \((j,k)\)-th mixed partial derivative of \(f\) at point \(x_i\).
  • g – A 1D array whose \(i\)-th element is the value of the function \(g\) at point \(x_i\).
  • g_jacobian – A 2D array whose \((i,j)\)-th element is the \(j\)-th component of the jacobian of \(g\) at point \(x_i\).
  • g_hessian – A 3D array whose \((i,j,k)\)-th element is the \((j,k)\)-th mixed partial derivative of \(g\) at point \(x_i\).
Returns:

hessian – A 3D array of shape (num_points, num_dimensions, num_dimensions). The \((i, j, k)\)-th element is the \((j, k)\)-th mixed partial derivative of \(f^2 g\) at point \(x_i\).
Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The required derivatives are as follows:

\[\begin{split}\frac{\partial f^2 g}{\partial x_j} & = & 2 f g \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_j} + f^2 \frac{\partial g}{\partial x_j} \\ \frac{\partial^2 V_i}{\partial x_j \partial x_k} & = & 2 f \left( g \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_j \partial x_k} + \frac{\partial g}{\partial x_j} \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_k} + \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_j} \frac{\partial g}{\partial x_k} \right) \\ & & + 2 g \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_j} \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_k} + f^2 \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_j \partial x_k}\end{split}\]
bayesquad.maths_helpers.jacobian_of_f_squared_times_g(*, f: numpy.ndarray, f_jacobian: numpy.ndarray, g: numpy.ndarray, g_jacobian: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Given two functions f and g, along with their jacobians, returns the jacobian of the function f^2 * g.

Parameters:
  • f – A 1D array whose \(i\)-th element is the value of the function \(f\) at point \(x_i\).
  • f_jacobian – A 2D array whose \((i,j)\)-th element is the \(j\)-th component of the jacobian of \(f\) at point \(x_i\).
  • g – A 1D array whose \(i\)-th element is the value of the function \(g\) at point \(x_i\).
  • g_jacobian – A 2D array whose \((i,j)\)-th element is the \(j\)-th component of the jacobian of \(g\) at point \(x_i\).
Returns:

jacobian – A 2D array of shape (num_points, num_dimensions). The \((i, j)\)-th element is the \(j\)-th component of the jacobian of \(f^2 g\) at point \(x_i\).
Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The required derivative is as follows:

\[\frac{\partial f^2 g}{\partial x_j} = 2 f g \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_j} + f^2 \frac{\partial g}{\partial x_j}\]
